body.p: State of Kentucky Breathitt County Sct

The affiant A. B. Patrick maketh oath and saith that not long since in a conversation with John Gambill the prosocution in the Case of The Commonwealth against Daniel Akerman who was convicted in the Perry Circuit Court to the penetentiary for stealing money from said Gambill

Said Gambill acknowledged to affiiant A B Patrick that he did not believe that Akerman Gambill hadd become satisfied that Akerman never got one cent of the money that he had lost and that would be glad if Akerman was pardoned and that he was willing to do any thing that was honorable to get Akerman pardoned

State of Kentucky
Breathitt County } Sct

Sworn to before me by A B Patrick this 3rd day of Sept 1861
J. P. B. C.
John Cardwell J. P. B. C.
Petition to the Governor & accompying papers asking that Danl Akerman convict in the state prison shall be pardoned

File in Akerman
Case -- B. M
